Documentation¶

class tgt.TextGrid(filename='')¶

A TextGrid.

add_tier(tier)¶

Add a tier.

add_tiers(tiers)¶

Add a list of tiers.

del_tiers(tier_names, complement=False)¶

If complement is False (the default), delete tiers with the specified names. If complement is True, delete tiers with names other than those specified.

end_time¶

TextGrid end time.

get_tier_by_name(name)¶

Get tier of specified name name.

get_tier_names()¶

Get names of all tiers.

has_tier(name)¶

Check whether TextGrid has a tier of the specified name.

insert_tier(tier, position)¶

Insert a tier at the specified position.

start_time¶

TextGrid start time.

class tgt.IntervalTier(start_time=0, end_time=0, name='', objects=None)¶

An IntervalTier.

add_interval(interval)¶

Add an interval to this tier. Insert an empty interval if necessary.

add_intervals(intervals)¶

Add a lisel of intervals to this tier.

get_interval_at_time(time)¶

Get interval at the specified time (or None).

get_interval_by_end_time(end_time)¶

Get interval with the specified right bound (or None).

get_interval_by_start_time(start_time)¶

Get interval with the specified left bound (or None).

get_intervals_between_timepoints(start, end, left_overlap=False, right_overlap=False)¶

Get intervals between start and end. If left_overlap or right_overlap is False (the default) intervals overlapping with start or end are excluded.

get_intervals_with_regex(regex='[^\s]+', n=0)¶

Get intervals with text matching the specified regular expression.

regex : str
Regular expression to match against (r’[^s]+’ by default).
n : int
The number of matches to return. If n > 0 the first n matches are returned, if n < 0, the last n matches are returned, if n = 0 (the default) all matches are returned.

List of matched intervals.

get_intervals_with_text(text, n=0)¶

Get intervals with the specified text.

text : str
String to match against.
n : int
The number of matches to return. If n > 0 the first n matches are returned, if n < 0, the last n matches are returned, if n = 0 (the default) all matches are returned.

List of matched intervals.

get_nearest_interval(time, direction='both', interval_label='[^\s]+', exclude_overlapped=False)¶

Get the nearest interval boundary in self in the specified direction matching interval_label. Returns a tuple of both boundaries if they are equally far from time and direction is ‘both’. If exclude_overlapped is True, the interval time falls into is skipped.

intervals¶

The list of intervals of this tier.

shift_boundaries(left, right)¶

Return a copy of the tier with boundaries shifted by the specified amount of time (in seconds). Positive values expand the tier and negative values shrink it, i.e.: * positive value of left shifts the left boundary to the left * negative value of left shifts the left boundary to the right * positive value of right shifts the right boundary to the right * negative value of right shifts the right boundary to the left.

class tgt.Interval(start_time, end_time, text='')¶

An interval of two points of time with an attached text label.

duration()¶

Get duration of this interval.

class tgt.PointTier(start_time=0, end_time=0, name='', objects=None)¶

A PointTier (also “TextTier”).

add_point(point)¶

Add a point to this tier.

add_points(points)¶

Adds a list of points to this tier.

get_point_at_time(time)¶

Get point at specified point of time.

get_points_between_timepoints(start, end, left_inclusive=False, right_inclusive=False)¶

Get intervals between start and end. If left_inclusive or right_inclusive is False (the default) points coinciding with start or end are excluded.

get_points_with_text(text, n=0)¶

Get points with the specified text.

text : str
String to match against.
n : int
The number of matches to return. If n > 0 the first n matches are returned, if n < 0, the last n matches are returned, if n = 0 (the default) all matches are returned.

List of matched points.

points¶

The list of points of this tier.

class tgt.Point(time, text)¶

A point of time with an attached text label.

class tgt.Time¶

A representation of point in time with a predefined precision.

tgt.read_textgrid(filename, encoding='utf-8')¶

Read a Praat TextGrid file and returns a TextGrid object.

tgt.read_short_textgrid(filename, stg)¶

Read a Praat short TextGrid file and return a TextGrid object.

tgt.read_long_textgrid(filename, stg)¶

Read a Praat long TextGrid file and return a TextGrid object.

tgt.export_to_short_textgrid(textgrid)¶

Convert a TextGrid object into a string of Praat short TextGrid format.

tgt.export_to_long_textgrid(textgrid)¶

Convert a TextGrid object into a string of Praat long TextGrid format.

tgt.write_to_file(textgrid, filename, format='short', encoding='utf-8', **kwargs)¶

Write a TextGrid object to a file in the specified format.

tgt.get_overlapping_intervals(tier1, tier2, regex='[^\\s]+', overlap_label='overlap')¶

Return a list of overlaps between intervals of tier1 and tier2 matching the regular expression. All nonempty intervals are included in the search by default.

agreement.cohen_kappa(a)¶

Calculates Cohen’s kappa for the input array.

agreement.fleiss_chance_agreement(a)¶

Returns the chance agreement for the input array.

agreement.fleiss_kappa(a)¶

Calculates Fleiss’s kappa for the input array (with categories in columns and items in rows).

agreement.fleiss_observed_agreement(a)¶

Return the observed agreement for the input array.

agreement.n_raters_table(l)¶

Returns a contingency table for n >= 2 raters (with categories in columns and items in rows) given a list of zipped labels.

agreement.produce_aligned_labels_lists(tiers_list, regex='[^\\s]+')¶

Creates a list of lists of labels matching the specified regular expression from time-aligned intervals of the input interval tiers.

agreement.scott_pi(a)¶

Calculates Scott’s Pi for the input array.

agreement.two_raters_table(l)¶

Returns a contingency table for two raters given a list of zipped labels.
